data.event: Quincy had its start in the year 1853 by the building of the New Albany Railroad (a precursor to the Monon Railroad) through that territory.

event.title: was received at the Owen County Courthouse in Spencer on June 7, 1853

data.event: This plat was received at the Owen County Courthouse in Spencer on June 7, 1853.
The town of Quincy was thriving when a fire was accidentally started on November 3, 1873.
Another fire occurred on May 9, 1930 which destroyed the same part of town.
This and the burning of the Quincy school on February 2, 1953 signaled the end of the town.
